description: During the Design Phase, the requirements defined during the Requirements Analysis Phase are transformed into detailed design specifications that will be used to build and code the system.
The design effort defines how the business product will operate to meet the requirements, including user interfaces, processes, data, and integration points.
Design includes database design, application design, user interface design, security design, and contingency planning.
The phase concludes when the design is baselined and approved, establishing the foundation for development.

responsibilities.Business Owner: Participates in the Preliminary Design Review and approves final design specifications.
responsibilities.Project Manager: Responsible for planning, execution, and control of the Design Phase; leads the Integrated Project Team (IPT) and ensures design artifacts are completed.
responsibilities.Integrated Project Team: Develops design specifications, participates in design walkthroughs, and ensures design aligns with requirements.

Critical Partners.Enterprise Architecture: Reviews high-level architectural design to ensure compliance with enterprise standards and Technical Reference Model.
Critical Partners.Security: Ensures that all required security and contingency documents are completed and compliant with federal standards (FIPS 199, NIST).
Critical Partners.Acquisition: Verifies that contracts fulfill requirements as awarded or through approved change requests.
Critical Partners.Budget: Confirms sufficient funding exists for phase activities and mitigates risk of cost overruns.
Critical Partners.Finance: Ensures cost estimates for current and future phases are updated and documented.
Critical Partners.HR: Ensures any design-related workforce issues are addressed.
Critical Partners.Section 508: Verifies accessibility requirements are incorporated and test cases for Section 508 are included.
Critical Partners.CPIC: Ensures design documentation aligns with the approved investment and baseline.
Critical Partners.Performance: Ensures risks are identified and mitigated within design specifications.
Critical Partners.Records Management: Ensures records management requirements are included in design artifacts.

activities: Develop detailed Design Document describing all aspects of the system architecture, modules, interfaces, and data structures.
Define data models, logical and physical database design, and data flow diagrams.
Design application logic, business rules, and user interface components.
Define hardware and software specifications and configurations for environments (development, testing, production).
Develop Contingency and Disaster Recovery Plans.
Prepare draft versions of Test Plan and Traceability Matrix for design verification.
Update Risk Management Plan, Configuration Management Plan, and Change Management Plan as required.
Conduct Preliminary Design Review (PDR) to confirm design completeness and compliance with requirements.
Include user representatives in design reviews to ensure usability and functionality alignment.
Update Acquisition Strategy to reflect any design-driven changes to contracts or procurements.
deliverables: Design Document (Functional, Technical, and Security Design).
Preliminary User Manual or Prototype Screens.
Updated Risk Management and Configuration Management Plans.

exit_criteria.objective: To determine whether the design is sufficiently complete and documented to support development activities.
phase_specific: No major feasibility or design issues remain unresolved.
Design is documented and traceable to approved requirements.
Security and contingency plans are complete and approved.
generic: Baselines reviewed and variances addressed (cost, schedule, and scope).
All required deliverables completed and approved.

project_review: The Preliminary Design Review (PDR) verifies that the design satisfies requirements and aligns with enterprise architecture and technical standards.
The Final Design Review (FDR) confirms readiness to begin development and establishes the design baseline.

stage_gate_review.title: Design Stage Gate Review
stage_gate_review.purpose: To determine readiness to proceed to the Development Phase based on completeness and quality of design documentation.
focus: Completion and approval of Design Document and supporting plans.
Verification that design aligns with requirements, enterprise standards, and performance objectives.
Confirmation that resources and contracts are ready for development execution.
